key_insight: An exploratory randomized controlled trial (N = 165 across five UK secondary schools) indicates that a pedagogy-finetuned generative model (LearnLM) integrated into chat-based math tutoring can safely and effectively support students in classroom settings.
problem_solved: One-to-one tutoring is highly effective but prohibitively expensive to scale; this work tests whether generative AI can expand access to personalized tutoring without compromising student safety or learning quality.
method: Deployed LearnLM (a generative model fine-tuned for pedagogy) within chat-based tutoring on the Eedi mathematics platform
Conducted an exploratory randomized controlled trial with 165 students across five UK secondary schools to evaluate learning outcomes and safety
Monitored safety and pedagogical quality through expert oversight, predefined safety checks, and classroom-integrated usage
impact: Demonstrates real-world feasibility of pedagogy-tuned generative models in classrooms, highlighting a practical path for scaling personalized tutoring while emphasizing the need for safety guardrails and rigorous field evaluation.
visual_elements: Trial flow diagram: recruitment → randomization → AI-tutoring vs. control → outcomes & safety monitoring
Before/after or relative improvement bar chart (learning gains) with error bars to summarize outcome trends
Safety & oversight infographic showing monitoring pipeline (automated checks + expert review)
Platform UI mockup: chat-based tutoring screenshot annotated with pedagogy features (hints, checks, feedback)
paper_title: AI tutoring can safely and effectively support students: An exploratory RCT in UK classrooms
paper_authors: LearnLM Team, Eedi, :, Albert Wang, Aliya Rysbek
